page.title: 12Adbolton Hall
page.content: {Adbolton Hall}is now a private nursing home for elderly people. It stands in five acres of grounds just off the lane which leads to the Holme Pierrepont Watersports Centre. Originally it was a private house owned latterly by the{Turney}family who owned a leather works in Nottingham. The trees in the grounds are very beautiful. The Hall has been used as a nursing home for some years now and in July 1984 a new extension was added to give them more accommodation. The house still has its original wooden doors and a lovely wooden staircase with big newel posts. The day room was originally the dining room and at the end of the room there is a beautiful big hand-carved fireplace.
